body_html: Also I don't think it has anything to do with xgboost per-se, b/c we can recreate the issue without any xgboost references. E.g. in torch.init.py:line 40 just after from torch._C import *, calling get_num_threads() returns 1
body_text: Also I don't think it has anything to do with xgboost per-se, b/c we can recreate the issue without any xgboost references. E.g. in torch.init.py:line 40 just after from torch._C import *, calling get_num_threads() returns 1
body: Also I don't think it has anything to do with xgboost per-se, b/c we can recreate the issue without any xgboost references. E.g. in torch.__init__.py:line 40 just after from torch._C import *, calling get_num_threads() returns 1
